title: Washita Battlefield National Historic Site: Physical / Mobility
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Accessibility     Physical / Mobility              Physical / Mobility        Visitor Center. The Visitor Center is fully wheelchair accessible, and also houses one wheelchair for visitor use if  needed. This wheelchairs is not suitable for the self-guided trail. Self-Guided Trail. The trail at the battle site is an unimproved trail and is not ADA Compliant. The trail is a 1 1/2 mile mowed section of a native grassland prairie. Some motorized wheelchairs have been able to take the trail, but this is left up to the users discretion. The park offers one (1) motorized electric car that seats three (3) people and a ranger and can be used on the trail. The electric car is subject to availability. Overlook. The battle site overlook is not wheelchair accessible. The overlook does have a vault bathroom. Dust and Fire Trail. The Forest Service Dust and Fire Trail around the Visitor Center is 1/2 mile and has a smooth surface. The park wheelchair is available to use on the Dust and Fire Trail upon request. The trail is not ADA approved.
